children: A 36-year-old man is evaluated for nephrolithiasis.
Which of the following is the most likely composition of this patient's kidney stone?

Calcium oxalate is the most likely composition of this patient's kidney stone. The urine sediment shown contains envelope-shaped calcium oxalate dihydrate crystals, which are associated with hyperoxaluria and calcium oxalate stone formation. These crystals can also be seen with ethylene glycol ingestion.

objective.__html: Diagnose calcium oxalate stone formation on the basis of calcium oxalate crystals seen on urinalysis.
